name: sesame seed production | sesame seed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21432/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of Sesame during May-September, 2016 at a farm located in village Lilapar, District Rajkot of Gujarat. The farm has a yield of 865 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 24-June, 2016 and harvesting date is 11-September, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 234.65-44.46 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 10,800 kg of manure from cattle dung. Only insecticide used has active ingredient as Organochlorine 120g/ha, Organophosphate 280g/ha. Machinery is used for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 70 kg/ha for land preparation. For other work process like transport, tractor and trailer fuel consumption of 10 kg/ha.

This activity starts about three weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in third week of May and sowing of seeds started about four weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 2.5 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Sesame from the Sesame plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 21-May, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 11-September, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 80 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Sesame follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'sesame seed' is calculated to be circa 4.69E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 9.38E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
